channel.title: First time smoking
channel.description: Did it today with 2 of my friends. Was ok but felt fucking wierd and after my breath didn't smell. Dunno why. Was pretty fun. Post when you first smoked. (Were gunna move up to cigars and bigger things when we can get it.)

item.title: First time smoking
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“Secet, post:80, topic:215390”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=283107.msg2301021#msg2301021 date=1214608871]
@Secet: You’re not a real smoker. sounds to me like you’re just puffing smoke with your friends, thinking you’re tough shit. no smoker can quit smoking so easily, it isn’t physically possible. i smoked for 3 years, i know exactly how hard it is to quit smoking.
[/quote]
I have already said I only smoke about 20 cigarettes per week, so that means i’m not “real smoker”. And yeah, I smoke with my friends alot, don’t you remember me saying that smoking is social event to me? And no, I don’t act tough. If I smoked when I was about 15 years old, then it would acting tough. But I’m now 17 and I have no reasons to act tough, everybody knows that I’m not.

I really don’t know why people think smoking = tough guy!!1

If you knew me IRL you wouldn’t say something like that. :)[/quote]
Being tough nowadays = fail.

Read full topic

item.title: First time smoking
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

I smoke occasionally and I find it quite enjoyable and relaxing.

Something that is annoying me about this thread, is that people seem to think that smoking once or twice a day will give you cancer or after that first toke you will start to feel sick/addicted etc… I’m sure the majority of health cases linked to smoking are caused by heavy smoking and not the odd cigarette now and then. Of course, I’m not saying smoking once or twice a day is healthy by any means, all I’m saying is that it isn’t as bad as people make it out to be.

Also, I don’t think people should force their views on other people. Give them information on the subject if it makes you happy, maybe advise them or try and show them the way you see it, but don’t force your views down their throat. If someone wants to smoke then more power to them, it’s their own choice and they shouldn’t have to be ridiculed by you because you think it is disgusting/pointless/dangerous/* habit.

I’m not very good at stringing more than a few sentences together coherently, so if you have trouble reading this, or think I haven’t put forward my ideas very well, then my apologies.

Read full topic

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“pk4pk, post:71, topic:215390”][quote author=gsheni link=topic=283107.msg2299943#msg2299943 date=1214555657]
io9 what I am trying to say is that i hope that he fixes his life now like is said and that if he doesn’t he will die. Why did you moderate me. I care so much because although i dont know him i was very raged by he said. I want to kick his ass because of how raged i am. I find it necessay to meddle with family affairs because i am trying to help him become a better person by tell him what is going to happen or atleast what i think will. I censored ass cause i felt like it.
[/quote]
Haha dipshit. Smoking actually dosen’t ruin your life. I’m not addicted. When you grow up smoking is a reliever and basically you do it socially, many famous and brilliant people smoke or smoked. And why the fuck to you care for someone you’ve never met. Probablly 8/10 children will try a cigarette before they pass the age 18.[/quote]
why? cigs suck.

item.title: First time smoking
item.dc:creator: @mikkomainer Secet
item.description:
@mikkomainer wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:66, topic:215390”][quote author=Secet link=topic=283107.msg2300453#msg2300453 date=1214587621]
So imo, it’s not hard at all to quit, you just have to be strong. It really depends on person.
[/quote]

Ah, but I could quit - I just don’t want to. But do I not want to because it’s enjoyable, or because it’s addictive? I’m not sure anymore, such is the nature of addiction - and if you don’t want to do something, you won’t do it, however “strong” you are :P[/quote]

Heh, good point.

Read full topic
